notesStmt.note: Incomplete at the beginning and at the end. Three leaves cancelled after folio 148, and two after folio 234.

Latin notes on the lower half of folio 236v: 'ex Bibliotheca, non J.B. Colbert, sed Caroli Joachimi Colbert Episcopi Montispessulani, quae A.D. 1740 publica subhastationis lege fuit dividenda.'An English description of the manuscript, pasted on the paper flyleaves at the beginning of the volume, folios 1v, 2r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Shibole ha-leḳeṭ and Hilkhot isur ve-heter by Zidkiyahu figlio di Abraham ha-Rofe Anav.

msItem.title: Hilkhot isur ve-heter הלכות איסור והיתר

supportDesc.foliation: The manuscript has two different foliations, one in the Hebrew order of folios, the other in the Latin order of folios.

collation.p: 41 quires of mostly 10 leaves each, numbered on the first leaf, in the left-hand upper corner. Wanting quires no. 1-4, the first leaf of the 5th quire and the last leaf of the 41st quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown leather, blind tooled, with Colbert's coat of arms on the upper and lower cover. Spine title: 'R. Zidkiah ben Abraham. Shebile Halleket. Hebraice. Mus. Brit. Iure Emptionis. 15,437.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849): purchased from him by the British Museum on 18 January 1845 (folio [364v]).
